item.title: [PDFBOX-2642] Unsupported: Type1 PFB fonts in CIDFontType0
item.description:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDCIDFontType0.getFontMatrix(PDCIDFontType0.java:169)
	at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDCIDFontType0.<init>(PDCIDFontType0.java:153)
	at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFontFactory.createDescendantFont(PDFontFactory.java:121)
	at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font.<init>(PDType0Font.java:95)
	at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFontFactory.createFont(PDFontFactory.java:83)

UPDATE: The PDF contains a CIDFontType0 which has a FontFile3 containing a Type1 PFB font. This is invalid, but Type1C is permitted and the two are equivalent, so it should be possible to handle this. However, the current design of PD CIDFontType0 does not permit it.
item.summary: Unsupported: Type1 PFB fonts in CIDFontType0

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

FontDirectory /Optima-Bold known{/Optima-Bold findfont/UniqueID get
6463 eq{save true}{false}ifelse}{false}ifelse
14 dict begin
/FontInfo 9 dict dup begin
  /version (001.001) readonly def
  /Notice (Optima is a trademark of Allied Corporation.) readonly def
  /FullName (Optima Bold) readonly def
  /FamilyName (Optima) readonly def
  /Weight (Bold) readonly def

etc...
So, this is a bad PDF because it has the SubType of the font set to CIDFontType0C instead of Type1, which isn't even valid for a CID font. We'll have to add a heuristic to detect such bad embedding.

Commit 1656101 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1656101 ]

PDFBOX-2642: Avoid NPE for damaged Type0 CID fonts
This fixes a small bug which cased an NPE to be thrown, rather than just logging a stack trace and continuing.

Commit 1656102 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1656102 ]

PDFBOX-2642: Log an error when a CIDFontType0 embeds a Type1 font

Fixing the underlying problem will require a major rework of PDCIDFontType0, as it wasn't designed for this scenario. I've added some code to detect this specific problem and log an error, but I'm not in a position to do anything more, currently.
